alert.note: Alert for Mendocino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 8:40AM PST until January 12 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in California... Russian River near Hopland affecting Mendocino County. For the Russian River...including Hopland...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Russian River near Hopland. * WHEN...Until Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Significant flooding of Highway 175 at the approaches to the Russian River bridge. Minor flooding of Highway 222 near Ukiah, and in crop land along the left and right banks of the Russian River near Hopland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 11.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this afternoon to 15.8 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight to 13.3 feet tomorrow morning. It will rise above flood stage again tomorrow afternoon to 16.1 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage again Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.3 feet on 04/07/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/eka. The next statement will be issued this evening at 845 PM PST.
